title: How to Reset an Alcatel Phone

steps.title: Turn off your Alcatel phone.
steps.content: Turn off your Alcatel phone. Tap and hold the Power button until the screen shuts down. When the screen completely fades to black, then it is already off. Depending on your model, the Power button can be found on the following: Top-right portion of the phone The right side of the phone The End-Call button (red button with the image of a telephone)

steps.title: Press and hold the pound (#) key and Power button at the same time for about 3 to 4 seconds.
steps.content: Press and hold the pound (#) key and Power button at the same time for about 3 to 4 seconds. You will be prompted that all the data will be deleted. If nothing happens, release the buttons and then press and hold them again.

steps.title: Select “Yes” to delete all data.
steps.content: Select “Yes” to delete all data. Use the phone cursor on your keypad and scroll down to the “Yes” option. Press the OK button to select it. The OK button is at the middle of the cursor at the middle of the phone. You will be presented a message that says “Formatting flash, please wait.”

steps.title: Do not remove the battery or touch any buttons during this process.
steps.content: Do not remove the battery or touch any buttons during this process. You are risking your phone to be bricked. When your phone is bricked, then you will not be able to turn the phone on.

steps.title: Wait for a while and then your phone will automatically reboot.
steps.content: Wait for a while and then your phone will automatically reboot. The phone will go through the normal rebooting process. Once you see the Alcatel logo during startup, then it means that your phone is on its way to rebooting.

steps.title: Turn off the phone.
steps.content: Turn off the phone. Press and hold the Power button for about 3 seconds. The Power button is at the top right of the phone. The screen should be pitch black when it’s turned off.

steps.title: Press and hold the Volume Up button and Power button at the same time.
steps.content: Press and hold the Volume Up button and Power button at the same time. Keep on holding the buttons until the Reset menu appears.

steps.title: Select your language by tapping on the desired option.
steps.content: Select your language by tapping on the desired option.

steps.title: Select “Yes - - delete all user data.
steps.content: Select “Yes - - delete all user data. ” Selecting this option will delete all user data. All your files, like music, photos, and apps, will all be deleted. You will see the Android mascot on the background with scripts at the lower part of the screen.

steps.title: Tap on the very first option that says “Reboot system now.
steps.content: Tap on the very first option that says “Reboot system now. ” The phone will now reboot automatically. When you see the Alcatel ONETOUCH logo, this signifies that the reboot is commencing.
